intro: Baccharis × volckmannii nothosubsp. volckmannii, commonly known as the hybrid baccharis, is a shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and showy yellow to orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. It is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal areas. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for erosion control and habitat restoration projects.
